reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars John Pascale’s review of thePost card from Italy
reviews.reviewText: The postcard from Italy was the best book that I’ve read in a long time. I enjoyed it so very much. I didn’t want it to end. A good book can be defined in that way. Thank you very much Angela.I have read many of your books and will continue to look for the ones that I haven’t read because you’re such a great writer .keep writingJohn Pascale

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Why people do what they do is the result of their circumstances, past and present, and their outcomes. We never really know the story of another until we take the time to ask and listen.I really love the development of these characters. It made getting to know them real and personal for me. I related with a few of the characters and I really liked a few of them. It is love that draws me to the ones I really like.It was easy to get lost in the emotions and forget the deep terror of war happening as the normal for these people's lives. I love the strength of them. I love the honor in them. I also love the hesitancy of following your heart after being burned by making that same choice earlier.Life is messy.War is messy.Love is messy but the rewards are better than one could ever hope to imagine.Take a leap into the leaps taken by these very ordinary people.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great 2 Generation story
reviews.reviewText: I love all of her work but this one was about WWII and the aftermath, and it was wonderful.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2022
reviews.reviewText: I downloaded this from Amazon first reads. The author does a great job portraying emotions in both Roberto and Antonella. The book is set in war torn Italy at the end of the war. Roberto jumped from a burning plans and suffered amnesia. He stayed with Antonella and her grandfather who nursed him back from his injuries. Recovering from amnesia more than a year later, he returns to England to see his infant son and wife who he never loved. Roberto had been declared dead so his wife remarried. He returns to Italy to be with his true love Antonella.Flash forward to current time following the death of the son, Frank. Frank's daughter is intrigued by post cards and a letter sent to her grandmother from England. Susannah travels to Puglia, Italy to find the house shown on a postcard. At the end Susannah unravels the mystery and finds her Italian family

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I liked the storyline. However the animosity between the grandmother and the lead and between the two sisters was too over the top to be believable.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Heartwarming but too long
reviews.reviewText: The first half of the book went slowly. The second part of the story moved quicker as the pieces all came together. Told in 2 time zones 1945 and Today, the true story of Susannah’s family all came together. There could have been more action to the book as the story dragged on in the first half, but overall it’s a sweet story.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Exciting, keeps you interested throughout many trials that were faced during the war. Highly recommend this book. You will be glad you read this book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very good story of World War II, mostly set in southern Italy
reviews.reviewText: Great story about more of World War II, the trials and tribulation of people of all sides of the war. The author describes scenes and feelings so that I could see and feel the anguish as well of the love, of the characters portrayed by her writing. I cannot wait to read more of her books.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on July 10, 2023
reviews.reviewText: A beautiful story really enjoyed reading about how life was back in 1945. Sometimes you have to take a leap of faith and hope someone catches you. Not easy taking in love but if you're lucky it's wonderful. Puglia has been only bucket list for a long while now really hope I get there soon.
Easy to get lost in the unfolding story of simple lives full of heartbreaking events. Not to be missed, you will love it.

reviews.reviewTitle: With every page you can imagine you are in Italy
reviews.reviewText: I was captured from the beginning to the end with this story
